notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to execute remote code.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Critical Manufacturing, Energy, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities.
notes.title: Exploitability

notes.text: Multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities can be exploited when the application processes specially crafted project files.CVE-2018-10602 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Updating to the latest version of LeviStudioU may address some of the vulnerabilities.

notes.text: Multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities can be exploited when the application processes specially crafted project files.CVE-2018-10606 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Updating to the latest version of LeviStudioU may address some of the vulnerabilities.

notes.text: An out-of-bounds vulnerability can be exploited when the application processes specially crafted project files.CVE-2018-10610 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 8.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Updating to the latest version of LeviStudioU may address some of the vulnerabilities.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

notes.text: An XXE vulnerability can be exploited when the application processes specially crafted project XML files.CVE-2018-10614 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.5 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Updating to the latest version of LeviStudioU may address some of the vulnerabilities.
